fr:title.text: Allowed constructions with straightedge and compass

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Allowed constructions with straightedge and compass

fr:mainmatter.fr:p:
With a straightedge and compass, we may only allow the first three of Euclid's postulates, i.e.:
draw a straightline (possibly passing through two given points), and
draw a circle. It follows that the only points we may construct with straightedge and compass along are:
The intersection of two lines;
The intersection of two circles; and
The intersection of a line and a circle.
